description: Erection of two storey side and single storey rear/side extension to house
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B1, ES6, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.9. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the submitted plan the proposed upper storey window in the side elevations shall be obscurely glazed and high level with a sill height no less than 1.8 metres above the finished floor level.  REASON:   In order to protect the privacy of the neighbouring residents, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B5, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9. | The extension permitted shall not be used or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as 18 Sandringham Road.  REASON:	To ensure that the character of the area is preserved and a separate dwelling is not created, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policy B1, Replacement UDP Policies 5.5, 5.9. | The flat roof to be created shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B1, B5, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B5, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9.
